cities.name: New York City
cities.description: The one with that big park.

cities.name: Antwerp
cities.description: The one with the cathedral that was never really finished.

cities.name: Paris
cities.description: The one with a big tower.

cities.name: Sofia
cities.description: The 15th largest city in the European Union.

pointsOfInterest.name: Central Park
pointsOfInterest.description: The most visited urban park in the United States.

pointsOfInterest.name: Empire State Building
pointsOfInterest.description: A 102-story skyscraper located in Midtown Manhattan.

pointsOfInterest.name: Cathedral of Our Lady
pointsOfInterest.description: A Gothic style cathedral, conceived by architects Jan and Pieter Appelmans.

pointsOfInterest.name: Antwerp Central Station
pointsOfInterest.description: The the finest example of railway architecture in Belgium.

pointsOfInterest.name: Eiffel Tower
pointsOfInterest.description: A wrought iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars, named after engineer Gustave Eiffel.

pointsOfInterest.name: Palace of Versailles
pointsOfInterest.description: The Palace of Versailles was the principal royal residence of France from 1682, under Louis XIV, until the start of the French Revolution in 1789. It is about 20 km (12 miles) southwest of Paris.

pointsOfInterest.name: Opera House
pointsOfInterest.description: The Sydney Opera House is a multi-venue performing arts centre at Sydney Harbour.

pointsOfInterest.name: Harbour Bridge
pointsOfInterest.description: It is a heritage-listed steel through arch bridge across Sydney Harbour that carries rail, vehicular, bicycle, and pedestrian traffic between the Sydney central business district and the North Shore

pointsOfInterest.name: Darling Harbour
pointsOfInterest.description: This waterside pocket of Sydney has got it all; amazing entertainment, fascinating museums, incredible wildlife and delicious dining options right on the water plus a brand-new food precinct.

pointsOfInterest.name: National Palace of Culture
pointsOfInterest.description: The largest, multifunctional conference and exhibition center in south-eastern Europe.

pointsOfInterest.name: Alexander Nevsky Cathedral
pointsOfInterest.description: Built in Neo-Byzantine style, it serves as the cathedral church of the Patriarch of Bulgaria and it is believed to be one of the top 50 largest Christian church buildings in the world.

pointsOfInterest.name: Statue of Liberty
pointsOfInterest.description: The Statue of Liberty is a colossal neoclassical sculpture on Liberty Island in New York Harbor in New York City.
